column4: but anyone got an ide why would xfce4 run in root but not as regular user?
idea*
What do you  mean 'xfce' is running as root.  xfce is the culmination of a couple of different processes
startxfce4 worked only as root, and gdm didn't let me login as normal user
but i just figured that it was because of .Iceauthority file in my /home
removing it fixed the problem :)
yeah probably that was the issue.  typically you should never log into gdm as root.  Doesn't xfce use xdm?
not that i know
mmm
well i think the .Iceauthorithy was remainings of my debian installation
debian has testing tough.
Yeah I guess those are very similar
the easy way or the hard way?
fast way :)
boot that hdd (does it boot?)
boots on the eeepc
how many hdd's do you have?
one on eeepc, one external, one on my desktop computer
so how i see if the grub is installed on the correct device?
boot that device
if grub is installed you will see grub / linux

ok, but this doesn't make sense, since the grub when i boot from external HD shows the ubuntu on the external HD and on the eeepc, but when i boot from eeepc hd i see only eeepc ubuntu as option, henche grub should be installed on the external hd, yet still it doesn't load on my desktop computer
